did.unittitle: Presbyterians United for Biblical Concerns records

bioghist.p: Presbyterians United for Biblical Confession (PUBC) was formed in 1965 as a response to concerns over the Confession of 1967. The PUBC proposed changes to effect a clearer affirmation of the inspiration and authority of the Bible. In 1966, the 178th General Assembly approved some of the changes suggested. The PUBC later changed its name to Presbyterians United for Biblical Concerns. In the summer of 1989 PUBC merged with Covenant Fellowship to form Presbyterians for Renewal.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of records of Presbyterians United for Biblical Concerns. Materials include: minutes, correspondence, memoranda, reports, and agendas from meetings of the Board, the Executive Committee, and annual meetings; executive director files, including correspondence, subject files, financial records, and employee records; files on a 1985 tour of the Holy Land; copies of Communique, 1978-1984, and New Updates, from the late 1980s; newsletters from the Presbyterians for Biblical Confession (precursor to PUBC), Presbyterians United for Biblical Confession and PUBC brochures; copies of various publications, including Presbyterian Journal, Presbyterian Outlook, and A.D.; newspaper clippings; and photographs of individuals and meetings. The collection also includes: files from task forces and conferences on various issues, which contain reports, memoranda, correspondence, and position statements; files on a dialogue between Presbyterians for Lesbian/Gay Concerns (PLGC) and PUBC sponsored by the Committee on Pluralism and Conflict; planning documents for PUBC participation at the General Assembly; and files related to the 1976 Consultation on Homosexuality (including logistical records, correspondence, and a printed report from the Consultation). Topics addressed include homosexuality, church union, women's ordination, youth evangelism, missions, theological education, the sanctuary movement, inclusive language, and prayer in schools.
